abstract: Coincidence? We think not. Only a few weeks after billionaire financier Carl C. Icahn took a 14.6 percent stake in WCI Communities and said he planned to have a talk with the homebuilder’s management about ways to “unlock the inherent value of the shares,” WCI announced that it hired Goldman Sachs to review its business plans “with the objective of enhancing the company’s value for all of its shareholders.” Among the actions being considered are share buybacks or a sale of the company, WCI chief executive Jerry Starkey said in a press release Monday (which made no mention of Mr. Icahn).
lead_paragraph: Coincidence? We think not. Only a few weeks after billionaire financier Carl C. Icahn took a 14.6 percent stake in WCI Communities and said he planned to have a talk with the homebuilder’s management about ways to “unlock the inherent value of the shares,” WCI announced that it hired Goldman Sachs to review its business plans “with the objective of enhancing the company’s value for all of its shareholders.” Among the actions being considered are share buybacks or a sale of the company, WCI chief executive Jerry Starkey said in a press release Monday (which made no mention of Mr. Icahn).

headline.main: WCI Considers Sale After Hearing From Icahn
